p: The aerial parts of O. vulgare contain essential oils with variable composition, as well as a diversity of flavonoids, tannins, phenolic glycosides, and terpenoids [ 20]. Luteolin- O-glucuronide and luteolin-7- O-glucoside are the main flavonoid derivatives found in the hydroalcoholic extracts, decoctions, and infusions of O. vulgareÂ¸ while rosmarinic acid is the main phenolic acid [ 21]. The presence of caffeic acid, protocatechuic acid, vanillic acid, and o-coumaric acid has also been reported [ 22].
